availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Brown (Caldwell co, ky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Eli Brown and Nancy Brown. Married to Hester Ann Trayler Brown in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in October 1852. Father of Nancy Brown, Sarah Brown, Eli Brown, Mildred Brown, and Florence Brown. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Employed John Armstrong as a farmhand in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 78B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 91-2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Fisher Spring, p. 127A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546372, p. 12.
"William Murry Brown (1829-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial #79995532, accessed June 9, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79995532.
